body: Check one of the latest PRs handling the packaging.

If the lambda package size limit is really 50MB as listed here [0], then neither Tacotron or Tacotron 2 are deployable there. The checkpoint alone is bigger than that.

[0] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/limits.html
tacotron1 is not serving parallel requests is there any memory leakage in tacotron1 or tacotron2
not that I know of

ERROR:tts:Error Occured while sending file :, e=The size of tensor a (45) must match the size of tensor b (40) at non-singleton dimension 1,  text: modi minaben ashok kumar Darshini


Tacotron1 is not performing multiprocessing .

This error message does not mean anything to me. Do you have more traceback?

What do you mean by multiprocessing exactly?

two parallel request should at the same time
like for one request it is taking around 2.5sec
and when I'm sending two requests parallelly (simultaneously) it is taking 5sec but idealy it should perform 2 or more parallel requests in 2.5sec

If you follow the instructions in the wiki to deploy the server behind nginx/uWSGI it should work fine. Is that what you are doing?

> like for one request it is taking around 2.5sec
> and when I'm sending two requests parallelly (simultaneously) it is taking 5sec but idealy it should perform 2 or more parallel requests in 2.5sec

no im using gunicorn with nginx
gunicorn might be the culprit. AFAIK @reuben is able to run on ngunx with mp support.
Yes, it's something in the deployment part. Check if Gunicorn has an equivalent setting as uWSGI's "processes" setting to control number of concurrent workers.
so what should i use ? nginx with uwsgi ?
What will be the best config to deploy tacotron1 ? would compiling pytorch from binary result in better response time ?

> so what should i use ? nginx with uwsgi ?

+1

Everything is documented here, it even includes configuration files for nginx/uWSGI.

I ran this command on t2 medium server  **(uwsgi --socket 0.0.0.0:5000 --protocol=http -w wsgi --processes=10  --wsgi-disable-file-wrapper)**

and send 10 parallel request 
outcome= first request took 32 sec(than what's the meaning of parallel processing ?)

@nmstoker how to deal with this? all the 10 paralle request should give the reponse in 3-4sec
@dimanshu try to run single process first and see how it performans. I'd guess 2 CPUs are not enough to run TTS in real time.
single process is taking 2-2.5sec per request. how many CPUs wil be sufficient for 30-40 parallel rquests .(30-40 requests in 3-4sec )
